title: SHM - max KE and amplitude graphs

content.description: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to one end of a horizontal spring, as shown in the figure. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall. There is negligible friction between the block and the surface. A student pulls back and releases the block from various positions and records the amplitude and maximum speed of the block.
content.question: The student creates a graph of the maximum kinetic energy <math alttext="K sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math> of the block as a function of the amplitude <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> of the blockâ€™s oscillation. Which of the following graphs best represents the expected shape of the graph?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled A, and the vertical axis is labeled K sub max. Grid lines are drawn but are not labeled. The curve starts at the origin and moves upward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually. The curve ends in the upper right part of the grid.
